Haruspex & Inquisitor

1.Inquisitor: And what can he who is called a Haruspex, a Warden, and the Ripper offer me?

1.Inquisitor: And what can he who is called a Haruspex, a Warden, and the Ripper offer me?

2.Haruspex: I wanted to explain myself.

2.Haruspex: I wanted to explain myself.

3.Inquisitor: Explain yourself? Your very self? How curious! Speak. I've found myself rather preoccupied with matters of identity lately! Seems like I've abandoned those matters all too early-seeing what they have done to me.

3.Inquisitor: Explain yourself? Your very self? How curious! Speak. I've found myself rather preoccupied with matters of identity lately! Seems like I've abandoned those matters all too early-seeing what they have done to me.

4.Haruspex: Our conversation is taking a strange turn...

4.Haruspex: Our conversation is taking a strange turn...

5.Inquisitor: No it isn't. Your father had invited you to his own funeral. And so you arrived-only to find him murdered. You then came into an inheritance, saddled with an obligation to save a creature that you know nothing about by making a panacea; it also warned you of a sacrifice it will inevitably require. Is that correct?

5.Inquisitor: No it isn't. Your father had invited you to his own funeral. And so you arrived-only to find him murdered. You then came into an inheritance, saddled with an obligation to save a creature that you know nothing about by making a panacea; it also warned you of a sacrifice it will inevitably require. Is that correct?

6.Haruspex: It is.

6.Haruspex: It is.

7.Inquisitor: So, they've made you invent a panacea? An unexpected move...

7.Inquisitor: So, they've made you invent a panacea? An unexpected move...

8.Haruspex: Made me? It was my choice.

8.Haruspex: Made me? It was my choice.

9.Inquisitor: You were masterfully led to this conclusion by the circumstances. You consider the creation of a panacea your principal goal-and do you really believe it was your idea all along?

9.Inquisitor: You were masterfully led to this conclusion by the circumstances. You consider the creation of a panacea your principal goal-and do you really believe it was your idea all along?

10.Haruspex: So what am I guilty of?

10.Haruspex: So what am I guilty of?

11.Inquisitor: Oh please, no one is blaming anyone here! Who in the world would call you guilty... the Powers That Be tricked you. You were set up. Who led you onto this path? Who was this malicious influence? You are but a pawn in their clumsy hands. A tool for someone else's execution.

11.Inquisitor: Oh please, no one is blaming anyone here! Who in the world would call you guilty... the Powers That Be tricked you. You were set up. Who led you onto this path? Who was this malicious influence? You are but a pawn in their clumsy hands. A tool for someone else's execution.

12.Haruspex: I do as I see fit. I choose my own path. If someone wants to use my choices for their scheming, so be it.

12.Haruspex: I do as I see fit. I choose my own path. If someone wants to use my choices for their scheming, so be it.

13.Inquisitor: ...That's some nerve. Or am I missing something...? Listen to me, you silly man, you've been played! Manipulated! My position comes with perks-facts, access to information. Don't you believe me? Do you need proof?

13.Inquisitor: ...That's some nerve. Or am I missing something...? Listen to me, you silly man, you've been played! Manipulated! My position comes with perks-facts, access to information. Don't you believe me? Do you need proof?

14.Haruspex: If someone works my part into their play, that's on them. I am only responsible for my own choices.

14.Haruspex: If someone works my part into their play, that's on them. I am only responsible for my own choices.

15.Inquisitor: ... A worthy answer.

15.Inquisitor: ... A worthy answer.

16.Haruspex: You seem visibly shaken. Why?

16.Haruspex: You seem visibly shaken. Why?

17.Inquisitor: It's strange. I never thought of it like that before. Is it really that simple?

17.Inquisitor: It's strange. I never thought of it like that before. Is it really that simple?

18.Haruspex: Being yourself isn't simple.

18.Haruspex: Being yourself isn't simple.

19.Inquisitor: ...Incredible. Let me take a closer look at you. Perhaps you were sent to me by fate? Wait... I need to think.

19.Inquisitor: ...Incredible. Let me take a closer look at you. Perhaps you were sent to me by fate? Wait... I need to think.

20.Haruspex: Take your time-and no need to worry about formalities. I prefer honesty to politeness.

20.Haruspex: Take your time-and no need to worry about formalities. I prefer honesty to politeness.

21.Inquisitor: ...Yes ...Here's what I think. The Bachelor told me you need a man-bull hybrid. I have a theory. Go to the Abattoir. It won't be closed, all entrances and exits are open on account of my arrival.

21.Inquisitor: ...Yes ...Here's what I think. The Bachelor told me you need a man-bull hybrid. I have a theory. Go to the Abattoir. It won't be closed, all entrances and exits are open on account of my arrival.

22.Haruspex: ...No way!

22.Haruspex: ...No way!

23.Inquisitor: ...Everyone who survived the Termitary lockdown is going back there. Use this to your advantage. Go to Foreman Oyun. Ask him about aurochses. Demand a part of the bull that I know was slaughtered here yesterday. Go. Why the long face? Go, go... before it's too late.

23.Inquisitor: ...Everyone who survived the Termitary lockdown is going back there. Use this to your advantage. Go to Foreman Oyun. Ask him about aurochses. Demand a part of the bull that I know was slaughtered here yesterday. Go. Why the long face? Go, go... before it's too late.

24.Haruspex: ...Okay. I have no idea what just happened, but I'm on my way.

11.Inquisitor: Who told you that? You don't even know who it is, and I suspect it's not even human! This is where metaphors come in. I have been preparing for this visit, you see, I've studied these rituals... They are all symbolic.

11.Inquisitor: Oh please, no one is blaming anyone here! Who in the world would call you guilty... the Powers That Be tricked you. You were set up. Who led you onto this path? Who was this malicious influence? You are but a pawn in their clumsy hands. A tool for someone else's execution.

11.Inquisitor: Oh please, no one is blaming anyone here! Who in the world would call you guilty... the Powers That Be tricked you. You were set up. Who led you onto this path? Who was this malicious influence? You are but a pawn in their clumsy hands. A tool for someone else's execution.

12.Haruspex: I do as I see fit. I choose my own path. If someone wants to use my choices for their scheming, so be it.

12.Haruspex: I do as I see fit. I choose my own path. If someone wants to use my choices for their scheming, so be it.

13.Inquisitor: ...That's some nerve. Or am I missing something...? Listen to me, you silly man, you've been played! Manipulated! My position comes with perks-facts, access to information. Don't you believe me? Do you need proof?

13.Inquisitor: ...That's some nerve. Or am I missing something...? Listen to me, you silly man, you've been played! Manipulated! My position comes with perks-facts, access to information. Don't you believe me? Do you need proof?

4.Haruspex: I thought this was going to be an interrogation... But this... is this a confession?

5.Inquisitor: No it isn't. Your father had invited you to his own funeral. And so you arrived-only to find him murdered. You then came into an inheritance, saddled with an obligation to save a creature that you know nothing about by making a panacea; it also warned you of a sacrifice it will inevitably require. Is that correct?

5.Inquisitor: No it isn't. Your father had invited you to his own funeral. And so you arrived-only to find him murdered. You then came into an inheritance, saddled with an obligation to save a creature that you know nothing about by making a panacea; it also warned you of a sacrifice it will inevitably require. Is that correct?

6.Haruspex: It is.

6.Haruspex: It is.

7.Inquisitor: So, they've made you invent a panacea? An unexpected move...

3.Inquisitor: I am well-prepared, though. I know your people's mythology. I know the legends of these lands. Tell me what you've learned there. Tell me where the blood came from. I will believe the most mind-boggling report-especially if it's consistent with my own data and... calculations.

4.Haruspex: There is a whole system of underground tunnels beneath the town, up to the Gorkhon river. Sacrificial blood has been poured down there for hundreds of years.

4.Haruspex: There is a whole system of underground tunnels beneath the town, up to the Gorkhon river. Sacrificial blood has been poured down there for hundreds of years.

5.Inquisitor: No surprise there. I've read about it when I was preparing for the trip. Furthermore, I know for sure that other peoples have similar cults. They all belong to different ethnic groups-some of them are northerners.

5.Inquisitor: No surprise there. I've read about it when I was preparing for the trip. Furthermore, I know for sure that other peoples have similar cults. They all belong to different ethnic groups-some of them are northerners.

6.Haruspex: The blood there is alive. That means the town nourishes it-and it probably nourishes the town. That's inexplicable-but it's a fact. Well? Is it consistent with your data and calculations?

6.Haruspex: The blood there is alive. That means the town nourishes it-and it probably nourishes the town. That's inexplicable-but it's a fact. Well? Is it consistent with your data and calculations?

7.Inquisitor: ...Well I'll be... It is consistent with the calculations. As for the data... well, it also is. This is why digging wells is prohibited around here.
